questions_and_answers.question: Who costed everyone a world series ring?
Which player had back-to-back complete games?
Which player had an all-time performance in the NL Championship Series game 4?
Why did Davis Schneider and Addison Barger wake up to stadium workers practicing player introductions at 9:00 a.m. on the morning of World Series Game 1?
questions_and_answers.answer: Because Addison Barger’s family had taken over his apartment for the series, forcing him to sleep on the pull-out couch in Davis Schneider’s hotel room overlooking Rogers Centre.

questions_and_answers.question: After being left out of the lineup for the AL Wild Card opener, how did Yankees star Jazz Chisholm Jr. reportedly blow off steam before his heroics in Game 2?
questions_and_answers.answer: He played MLB The Show and mercy-ruled his opponent.

questions_and_answers.question: Which Detroit Tigers player celebrated their Wild Card Series clincher over Cleveland by performing karaoke in a pool of champagne and beer?
Following the Padres’ season-ending loss to the Cubs, what specific act of clubhouse service did rookie Jackson Merrill perform for his teammates?
questions_and_answers.answer: He walked to a cooler and brought back cold beverages, carrying two in each hand and two in his back pockets.

questions_and_answers.question: What Yankees franchise record did rookie Cam Schlittler set during the first inning of his postseason debut against Boston?
questions_and_answers.answer: He threw six pitches at 100 mph or faster in the first inning alone—more than all Yankees pitchers had combined to throw in postseason history since pitch tracking began in 2008.

questions_and_answers.question: What two factors made Aaron Judge’s Game 3 home run against the Blue Jays the first pitch of its kind ever homered off of since 2008?
questions_and_answers.answer: The pitch was 99+ mph and located 1.2 feet inside off the center of the plate.

questions_and_answers.question: What historic home run feat did Michael Busch accomplish during the NLDS against the Brewers?
questions_and_answers.answer: He became the first player in MLB history to hit multiple leadoff home runs in a single postseason series.

questions_and_answers.question: Who hit the fastest pitch ever recorded for a home run in postseason history, and what was the speed?
questions_and_answers.answer: Jackson Chourio homered off a 101.4 mph fastball from Daniel Palencia in NLDS Game 2.

questions_and_answers.question: How did the first 8-6-2 double play in postseason history occur during NLCS Game 1?
questions_and_answers.answer: Max Muncy hit a ball off the center-field wall; Sal Frelick fielded it and threw to Joey Ortiz, who relayed home to William Contreras to force out Teoscar Hernández, after which Will Smith was doubled off at third.

questions_and_answers.question: After an 18-inning loss in World Series Game 3, which Blue Jays player referred to his teammates as "uncommon men"?
What rare ground-rule occurrence prevented the Blue Jays from scoring two runs in the 9th inning of World Series Game 6?
questions_and_answers.answer: Addison Barger’s drive became lodged under the left-center field wall, resulting in a ground-rule double that forced runners to return to second and third base.

questions_and_answers.question: What does A.J. Hinch mean when he refers to the "19th at-bat"?
questions_and_answers.answer: It refers to the third time through the batting order, when he forces an opposing manager to make a high-leverage bullpen decision.

questions_and_answers.question: In the winner-take-all NLDS Game 5, which National League team started their All-Star closer as the opener?
questions_and_answers.answer: The Milwaukee Brewers, with Trevor Megill serving as the opener.

questions_and_answers.question: How many times was Shohei Ohtani walked in World Series Game 3, and how many were intentional?
questions_and_answers.answer: He was walked five times total, four of them intentionally.

questions_and_answers.question: What was unusual about the shoes Brewers owner Mark Attanasio wore for the NLDS Game 5 clincher?
questions_and_answers.answer: They were so old that the equipment manager had to glue them back together before the game.
